Constructing the future of Indian healthcare through an amalgamation of leading medical brains of the country with best-in-class technology.Previous consulting experience at Monitor Group and Deloitte, specializing in digital health, value-based care, innovation, and growth in therapeutic areas (cardiology, diabetes, obesity, oncology, ophthalmology).Experienced with the analytics and service side of the Healthcare industry through experience at PharmARC Analytic Solutions Pvt. MBA from IIM Kozhikode and Pharmacy (Hons.) graduate from BITS Pilani â€“ Pilani campus.Key Competency Areas:Emerging market strategy, Digital Health, Value Based Care, Chronic Care Coordination, Consumer buying behavior, Epidemiology, Innovation, Competitive intelligence

jobs.description:
Next-generation Medical AI to treat diabetes and co-morbidities.

Zyla has developed a personalized diabetes solution powered by a deep learning-enabled â€œmedical brainâ€, that analyzes millions of data points across the patient history in real-time to deliver the most accurate medical interventions across medications, symptoms, diagnostics, nutrition and exercise.

Today, in India alone, more than 250 million people are suffering from chronic diseases (such as diabetes and heart disease). These people are currently at the mercy of a very unstructured healthcare system with no one to take ownership of their health. This results in a poor quality of life, increasing diseases and complications, and recurring hospitalisations. Zyla is one-of-its-kind healthcare technology solution completely focused on patient outcomes.

Zyla provides subscription-based, virtual health management personalised for each individual, with continuous monitoring on the Zyla mobile application. It involves a wide range of interventions from observing small habits to recommending necessary medical interventions. At the heart of this care delivery, lies a "medical brain" built using 1000+ medical protocols, NLP, Machine Learning, and AI, which flags timely interventions, delivers first level of intelligent & real-time responses to patients, and helps medical practitioners deliver data-driven care which is practically non-existent today. Zyla envisages to be the healthcare assistant for millions of families across the globe!

With exemplary patient outcomes and program renewal rates of 80%+, Zyla is on course to build a world-class and scalable product which creates a long- lasting impact on humanity, in this case, saving lives! If you are passionate about building one, let's get in touch!

general.headline: Customer Data Platform (CDP) | Data Orchestration | Identity Resolution | Single Customer View | Digital Analytics | Breaking Data Silos & Helping Marketers Deliver Personalized Experiences to Customers in Real-Time!
general.description: Coming from a genuinely cosmopolitan background and being a constant collector of life experiences, I consider myself a solution-oriented team player full of positive energy. My previous work experiences have provided me with a great chance to learn and grow and I have worked in Customer Success, Programmatic & Social Advertising Operations, Business Development & Sales Support, Social Media Marketing, Event Planning, Market Research, Media Planning, and Software Engineering (SAP).I completed my Masters in Integrated Marketing Communication from Emerson College, Boston and my Bachelors in Computer Science Engineering from BITS Pilani Dubai Campus, and it has been a wonderful journey so far. Being a multilingual extrovert who is always focused and determined to achieve goals, I strongly believe that a combination of hard work, loyalty, persistence, and faith is the key to success.

jobs.description:
e-CENS is an internationally recognized team of data scientists, analysts, and strategists. We are partners with Tealium, which is a Customer Data Platform (CDP) that helps with data collection, data unification and data orchestration across channels. 

As technologies become more sophisticated, so is the modern-day customer. Customers move fast and it's important to have personalized customer engagement. And what really sets one company apart from another extends beyond engagement - it lies in the ability to create and manage a positive & unique customer experience. We can help you find a single approach to managing data across teams, vendors, and customer touchpoints in real-time. 

Tealium allows you to manage all your critical data points across all digital and physical channels in one centralized platform. It could help enhance your company's ability in tailoring solutions to meet customer needs by understanding each customers' 'Buying Propensity' and creating more 'Personalized Experiences'. Tealium pulls the limited data sources into a Single Customer View - you could use your 1st party data to create real-time audience segments and tailor your digital onsite and offsite marketing to great effect, thereby providing a good experience to your customers. 

While Applications solve the 'Campaign Problem', Tealium solves the 'Customer Problem'! #ecens #tealium

jobs.jobTitle: Business Development Manager - Digital Sales (6-Month Contract)
jobs.description:
AUTOLiNK.careers is an online job portal (startup) dedicated to Automotive & Transport industry. As a Digital Customer Success Manager, my job duties included the following.
- Managed a team of 4 employees to generate product awareness and online sales for AUTOLiNK.careers (Digital Sales of CV Search Packages, Post & Feature Jobs, Feature Companies) through digital campaigns and approaches thereby ensuring Customer Success.
- Launched and optimized email marketing campaigns, social media campaigns, and viral marketing campaigns to drive brand awareness through digital strategy and content generation (Using SendinBlue and MailChimp ESPs for Email Marketing and Hootsuite for Social Media Marketing).
- Created and published engaging content such as blog posts and social campaign posts and editing, proofreading, and improving content as well as branding.
- On-boarded and trained clients and prospects on the AUTOLiNK.careers platform.
- Developed and implemented online strategies aiming to promote the companyâ€™s mission and â€œvoiceâ€ through digital strategy, content generation, and lead generation on various digital channels.

- Stayed up-to-date with the latest trends in the Automotive & Transport industry and generated new ideas to draw audienceâ€™s attention for the company's IT B2B product through market research.
- Achieved customer success through understanding customer requirements, implementing and onboarding new customers on the job portal, driving adoption and customer retention, and ensuring ongoing satisfaction thereby resulting in revenue growth.

AgilOne (startup) is a Software as a Service (SaaS) based Customer Data Platform (CDP) for enterprise B2C companies with a vision to restore the personal relationships companies once had with customers. As a CSM, my job duties included the following.

- Managed a portfolio of 4 Enterprise B2C customers (C-Level stakeholders) with revenue ranging between $600,000 to $4M and exceeded CS targets in 2017 by 10% leading to strategic account growth.
- Responsible for customer success through account management by understanding customer requirements, implementing and onboarding new customers, driving adoption and customer retention, and ensuring ongoing satisfaction thereby resulting in renewals and revenue growth. 
- Collaborated with Sales, Implementation, Professional Services, Product, Support, and Marketing teams to maximize overall customer experience and enable customer engagement.
- Leveraged a comprehensive understanding of the AgilOne solution thereby providing training, reporting, and strategic lifecycle campaign recommendations.
- Contacted regular and prospective customers to develop success plans to help customers rapidly achieve ROI via the Metrics, Actions/Campaigns, and 360 Customer Profile platform modules.

Bridge Marketing is a mobile-first data-driven marketing company (SaaS based) that allows marketers to reach their ideal consumers through integrated multi-channel campaign solutions. As an Ad Ops Manager, my job duties included the following:

- Managed a book of business of 15 B2B customers (Strategic Account Management) in conjunction with the Account Managers as a key member of the Advertising Operations team.
- Launched and monitored an average of three dozen programmatic and social advertising campaigns per week for all customers using The Trade Desk and Facebook Business Manager and served as a primary point of contact during periods of surge campaign traffic.

- Assisted in the process of Creative Quality Assurance, generation of Performance Reports and owning Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and creation of Campaign Summaries.
- Optimized digital campaigns, reviewed reports, and made technical suggestions for improved performance to both internal teams and clients, while also establishing benchmarks and recommending improvements for future campaigns.

Project Description:

Ericsson Network IQ is a performance management tool used by Ericsson to generate network's performance report using Business Objects. Its major task is to collect performance management data from various network nodes. It is a multi-vendor and multi technology performance management tool based on ETL process. The ETL process is being taken care by a proprietary tool (EPFG) which generates the performance management data in the ENIQ server, takes care that the data files is generated in a specified format (.xml) & load the data files into the Sybase IQ. Ericsson Network IQ comprises (ENIQ) of a set of modules known as technology packages. Technology packages are designed to collect performance statistics information from the network. Technology packages provide end users an easy and flexible Access to performance data.

general.headline: MS in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson | Data Science | Consulting | BITS Pilani | Ex-Mu Sigma | Ex-Tesco PLC
general.description: I harness the power of data to tell the stories that drive business strategy. I am a highly creative data science professional and MS in Business Analytics candidate at UCLA Anderson. I have five years of analytics/data science experience in retail and digital advertising including Fortune 100 companies. I have also helped early stage start-ups make first forays into analytics. Over the last five years, I have worked on projects related to sales forecasting, user behaviour analytics, text analytics, AB testing and product analytics. Technical Languages: R, Python, SQL, COSMOS DB, Hive SQL, C#Visualization/Presentation Tools: Tableau, Power BI, MS PowerPoint, R (ggplot2), Python (matplotlib)Automation Tools: Alteryx, VBAI believe that asking and answering the right questions can have a massive impact on your business. Below is a glimpse of questions I have asked and answered over the last five years:	- How do you explain data science outputs to business leaders?	- How do you explain a forecasting model so that it is no longer a black box?	- How is your search advertisement business impacted if Amazon eats up your searches?	- When a query contains a 'Dominant Advertiser' (advertiser explicitly mentioned in the query), is it still worthwhile to display its competitor?With knowledge of the entire data science chain and an ability to quickly understand any business concept, I am confident I can add value to your business. Please free to connect - taufeeq.rahmani.2020@anderson.ucla.edu

general.headline: Data Scientist II, Microsoft AI || Harvard || BITS Pilani Goa
general.description: Data scientist with experience across the corporate, social and research arms of data science. I had the chance to set up and lead a data team, wherein I mentored over 30 volunteers into data science for social good. I am particularly interested in the resonance between real world problems and data-powered solution.My data experience revolves the most around the R programming language, followed by Python. My work in R includes data wrangling(dplyr/tidyverse), visualisation(ggplot), regression modelling, time series analysis, dashboard automation, machine learning and big data operations for Spark(sparklyr) and h2o. A large array of my experience revolves around Tree-based models in Supervised learning(Gradient Boosting, Random Forests and Decision Trees) and Clustering in Unsupervised Learning(kmeans, Hierarchical clustering, Spectral clustering). My Python experience has primarily been for Deep Learning(keras and PyTorch) and Matrix methods and operations. I have also developed a strong interest in manual Python implementations of machine learning algorithms(NumPy, SciPy) such as Support Vector Machines, Artificial Neural Networks, kmeans, Hierarchical clustering etc in Python to understand and use them better.I built up command over Advanced MS Excel through Pharmaceutical Consulting, Tableau for dashboarding of signals for a major communications firm as well as basic command over SQL through multiple projects.  A large part of my data science experience lies in Healthcare, followed by social data, real estate and communications. However, I am very excited for novel learning opportunities across fields where I can use mathematical, technological, creative and leadership skills in tandem to solve real world problems. I live my life on a quote - â€œThe biggest quality you need as a data scientist is the willingness to feel stupid every single day.â€ Feel free to reach out to chat about anything above, anything that could be above or just as a friendly greeting!

jobs.description: Data Scientist in the FY20 Cohort of the Microsoft AI Development Acceleration Program
Worked with Dr. Xihong Lin's research group, developing a unique functional annotation tool for vector representation and querying of genetic variants, using R and PostgreSQL on a Google Cloud VM

Worked with the Data Science team of the Arnhold Institute for Global Health. We designed a deep learning solution based on Convolutional Neural Networks that can be fed in aerial drone images from third world countries to be able to detect abandoned tires in them. Abandoned tires are a health hazard, since mosquitoes can breed in the water that accumulates inside them, leading to the spread of many vector-borne diseases such as Malaria, Dengue fever, yellow fever etc. 

One of the improvements we made make to the previous attempts is to create a tighter bound for the bounding boxes by deriving an ideal bounding box size in pixels based on flight altitude of the drone and focal length of the camera used. We estimated the flight altitude by making use of the  dimensions of freightliner trucks that are visible in many drone images.

Safecity is a non-profit based out of Mumbai, India which crowd maps data on gender-based harassment and uses innovative Data Analytics to combat it. With active partners in multiple countries such as Kenya, Cameroon and Nepal to collect data on a global scale and collaborations with Twitter and UPenn, Safecity works closely with the Police forces of multiple cities to enable it's unique data and analytics to create a difference in a dire cause.

Following my brief tenure as a volunteer for data analysis, I took over as the Head Data Scientist to build a data science team for Safecity and continually brainstorm and direct the new data team into newer angles of analysis to extract deeply hidden insights. The role also enables direct collaboration with multiple US-based Data Organizations. My work includes(but isn't limited to):

Creating and maintaining elaborate dashboards(using MS Excel and Tableau) to dynamically update time-based(multi-level) and/or harassment type-based and/or location-based incident trends to continually gather updated insights 

Implementing Text Analysis using R to dissect textual descriptions of incident reports to gather indirect insights about incident nature, type of location, situational correlations etc.

Drawing parallels from Retail's Market Basket Analysis to analyze the relationship between different types of harassment crimes

Clustering the incident reports based on inclusive incident types using segmentation techniques like Latent Class Analysis using R/SAS

Developing a multi-code system using Voronoi Diagrams and clustering techniques like K-Means(Using SAS) to effectively identify and easily point to any locality under Safecity's consideration, with space for dynamic additions moving forward

Keeping a track of various social media trends about gender-based crimes, both within the organization and externally, using methods such as Twitter analytics, using R

- Created a dynamic network intelligence data visualisation dashboard on Tableau aimed at network optimization and a long-term organizational saving of $7m

- Initiated a bandwidth prediction machine learning project based on historical data

Worked with the COO to optimize construction material purchases through price tracking, time series forecasting and report automation. I was able to cut down the daily dashboarding time from 4-5 hours to under 2 minutes using end-to-end automation.

ZS Associates is a global sales and marketing Consultancy based out of Evanston, US primarily focusing on broad analytics for Pharmaceutical Corporations. As a Business Analyst at ZS, I was involved in creating long-term strategy for an upcoming Business unit of a leading US-based Biotechnology and Pharmaceutical Corporation. For this, we dynamically extracted insights from highly descriptive text to create broad themes updated over time.

I also worked in the space of Predictive Analytics, creating and optimizing prediction systems to predict physicians based on sets of Twitter data and predict Medical Insurance Premiums based on a wide array of variables. R was the tool of choice to implement generalized non-linear regression modeling for the purpose. My effort was able to come up with better results than 48 other similar efforts.

I also worked in time series prediction of pharmaceutical product sales, where an ARIMA variant implemented in R emerged the final best model. In line with the previous project, this one was better than 50 other similar efforts.

The project of the largest scale that I worked on here, was one to predict the presence of the 'Pap Smear Test' for Cervical Cancer in the medical history of female patients, based on diverse data such as Physician visits, diagnosis, prescriptions etc. The data was spread out across 11 tables which we hosted on a Teradata Server. The features were engineered using domain knowledge into a total of 684 predictors for 1.5 million female patients and both R and Python were used to model the data, hosted on an AWS server. The well-balanced dataset gave almost 91% accuracy for our prediction model.

I offered my service to help with holistic segmentation and clustering of clientele based on telecommunication parameters. Cluster bootstrapping with resampling cycles were employed on multiple clustering algorithms to achieve this.

Mu Sigma is one of the world's leading pure play provider of Analytics. I was an intern in the Analytical Research wing of Mu Sigma for a year. The Analytical Research team worked behind the scenes of muRx, Mu Sigma's flagship Decision Sciences workbench, which is an all-in-one analytical solution based on SAS and R, to perform everything from data cleaning to complex analysis and report creation. As a member of the Analytical Research team, my responsibilities included(but not limited to):

Continually researching new analytical techniques and methodologies and developing and deriving them further to implement them in muRx

Implementing basic Machine Learning R codes for Support Vector Machines, for integration into muRx

Creating 'Hybrid Clustering' algorithm and implementing them in SAS for integration into muRx

Implementing Category-Based Time Series Lag Variables in R, for integration into muRx

Conducting extensive research on 'Distance Matching' metrics and techniques, complete with deep and core Mathematical background to enhance and develop the Distance Matching module on muRx

Assisting the Agile Scrum Master to carry out scrum duties on a daily-basis

We brought together the changemakers of the society namely the Corporates, NGOs and Volunteers for mutual benefit to each other. Corporate Social Responsibility is an important part of any corporate life today, and it is a way by which any corporate can give back to the society which sustains them, while reaping benefits out of it as well. Since dedicating a separate team just for CSR, commands the use of a lot more resources, a general trend follows the search of collaborations of corporates with NGOs. However, we understood that a very good number of corporates out there in the sphere are facing problems finding a good, right, trustworthy and credible NGO who can take their CSR forward. On the other side of the spectrum, NGOs are in fact, searching for socially responsible and caring parties, to help them take their projects forward, as the funding issues they face are manifold. This scenario suggests that the bridge between the two is foggy. This is where changemaker.be came in. Through us, you and your company could easily find the right NGO to suit your CSR needs and the right project to go along with it, based on your intuition or our suggestions. You had the option of choosing your preferred CSR based on various factors like cause, NGO, location, scale and a lot more. Once you had found out your required project and NGO, changemaker.be took the initiative in moving the deal forward and making it a reality.

jobs.companyName: Department of Journalism and Media Affairs, BPGC
jobs.description:
The Department of Journalism and Media Affairs(DoJMA) handles the entire official content and media relations of BITS Pilani K K Birla Goa Campus. The department is responsible for many campus publications like 'The BITS Herald', the monthly newsletter, 'Campus Watch', informal day-to-day reporting, 'Special Correspondence', a chance for the general body to report etc. Apart from these publications, DoJMA also handles the entire content requirement of all 3 festivals of campus, namely Waves, Quark and SPREE (arts, tech, sports), covering marketing brochures, publicity brochures, website contents, mailers, proposals, invites and a lot more. In the past, DoJMA's articles have projected the image of the campus widely in Goan Media. jobs.description:
I worked on Price and Promotion Optimization projects at Target Corp. Few key projects: 
â— Item Identification - Develop a product attributes matching algorithm in Python using word embeddings trained with CBOW neural network. This work is used to match competitor items to Targetâ€™s assortment, reducing manual effort in matching by 80%
â— Price Elasticity - Developed an additive and interaction log-log model in R to calculate item price and cross-price elasticity of demand. These elasticity estimates are used to check the impact of price markdown before the markdowns are implemented

â— Item Line Grouping - Implemented a classifier in R for grouping new items in the existing manually classified line groups in the assortment. It uses Boruta algorithm for feature selection and customized NaÃ¯ve Bayes classifier to suit the multiclass imbalanced problem. Also, developed a hierarchical clustering model to cluster new item line groups based on the selected item attributes. This work has increased competitive assortment by 31% by adding 15k new items and saving $2.4 million a year
â— Item Segmentation - Developed a k-means clustering model in R for dividing the assortment into different item segments. The model considers factors like sales quantity, competitor price variability/volatility, and seasonality to classify items into categories. The model considers factors like sales quantity, seasonality, competitor price variability and volatility for clustering. These groups are used to determine competitor itemsâ€™ shopping frequency and price index
â— Basket Size Analysis -Devised a methodology to measure the impact of promotions on the basket size. Two groups are created target group and a comparable group, the lift between the two gives the quantifiable impact due to promotion

jobs.description:
Pushstart is India's most active community for Entrepreneurs to Express themselves and Connect with other like-minded people. 

Our vision is to help individuals grow in their Business, Professional and Personal Life. We believe that growth is directly proportional to access to Relevant Knowledge, Network and Opportunities. 

Knowledge Community: 
We have an active online community of 20k+ members across India where Entrepreneurs share their ideas and problems, launch their startup and share their knowledge on a daily basis. 

We organize Webinars, AMA, Online sessions with Top Experts/Founders across the world on a regular basis for our knowledge Community. 

Network Community: 
We have an active online community of 3k+ mid-stage entrepreneurs where they seek and share business connections on a daily basis. 

We organize regular events for our Network community so that relevant entrepreneurs meet and grow their Knowledge and Network. 

Networking through our online community and offline events lead to business collaborations, partnerships, and deals among members. 

In the last 1.5 years, we have been successful in associating 20k+ entrepreneurs in 15+ cities in India with 200+ networking events. 

Currently, we are working on building a platform through which people can monetize their Knowledge and Network.

I am currently trying to come up with the best possible framework to help shape the Startup journey of an entrepreneur.

jobs.companyName: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
jobs.description:
Inductive Logic Programming is a relatively new field that lies at the intersection of
logic programming and inductive machine learning. Inductive Logic Programming can
construct rules or hypotheses by learning from examples and background knowledge
- something other fields of Machine learning do not do. 

My work involved finding out if I feed examples to an Inductive Logic Programming System, would it construct relevant features which could train a great machine learning model with maximum entropy. The study aimed to combine the logical power of Inductive Logic Programming,
and Probabilistic wonder of Maximum Entropy model. It serves as a step
towards the big goal of combining logical learning and probabilistic learning, which
is together called Statistical Relation learning, or sometimes Probabilistic Inductive
Logic Programming.

jobs.description:
Making GMaps awesome(r) !! 

My project is focussed on inferring the places that a user visits based on various signals like device location, navigation preferences, web history, etc. Such inferences and then used to provide magical dining experiences, commute experiences, shopping and delivery experiences and much more.
I am majorly aiming at inferring specific characteristics of user like
1) likely profession of the user
2) cuisine preferences of the user
3) detect change in user preferences
4) areas that the user is most familiar with
5) detecting odd work patterns - driving jobs, nighttime jobs, weekend jobs etc.

jobs.companyName: Carnegie Mellon University - School of Computer Science - Language Technologies Institute
jobs.description:
Understanding Harry Porter in an Alternate Universe! 

I worked with Prof. Carolyn Rose on improving the Natural Language Processing tasks on the fan-fictions written by mostly teen authors. The project is in collaboration with Yahoo and Tumblr and the final aim is to create chat-bots having personalities of the fictitious characters introduced in the fan-fictions. We focussed majorly on fan-fictions of Harry Porter, Friends and My Hero Academia.
I primarily worked on improving the Coreference Resolution of the fan-fictions by combining features from Standford CoreNLP Statistical model and Neural Coref Models by AllenAI. Major challenges involved handling genders, aliases and inconsistent and informal writing techniques of authors.

Worked as the lead developer and designer for China Download Manager, a entirely new version of Adobe Download Manager with dynamic features for providing third party offers. The installer is successfully released in China and is expected to increase the revenue of the team multi-fold.  
This new dynamic installer can be configured to work with any number of third party offers and in many different modes. Responsible for the design, implementation and code/design review of the installer.
Also, work involved working with multiple teams working in different team zones.

â€¢  Also worked on a side-project which involved extracting spatial information and exact geometry of objects using Microsoft Hololens. jobs.description:
Department of Sponsorship and Marketing (DoSM) is a group of students managing sponsorship and marketing related activities of the three festivals of BITS Pilani K.K.Birla Goa Campus which are:
1.Waves,the cultural festival.
2.Quark,the technical festival
3.Spree,the sports festival.
DoSM seeks not just for cash sponsorship but also in-kind sponsorship. Besides this DoSM also handles various media associations for promotion of the three festivals and the sponsors. One of the primary jobs of DoSM is to design marketing strategies for the sponsors, ensuring that they get full value for the money invested in the festivals. It is a training ground for students pursuing engineering to improve their communication skills, to develop a sense about marketing and most importantly learn how to become effective as an individual and a team player.

As a Trainee in the GRID (Government Reforms and Infrastructure Development) practice within the Advisory Line of Service, worked out of Jaipur, Rajasthan (India), as the Client Location, for the project - Independent Review of Energy Auditing for Financial Year 2015-16. The project involved revenue auditing of the three Distribution Companies in Rajasthan, namely, JVVNL, JdVVNL, and AVVNL, located in Jaipur, Jodhpur, and Ajmer, respectively. 

Hierarchy is as follows:
Distribution Company -> Zone -> Circle -> Division -> Subdivision 

The goal of the project is to obtain the real figures of what are known as Aggregate Technical and Commercial (AT&C) losses. The AT&C loss is itself comprised of two figures, namely, Transmission and Distribution (T&D) loss and Collection Efficiency. The T&D loss could be computed by taking the difference of the Output Energy being fed out from the Distribution Network and the Input Energy being fed into the Distribution Network. The Collection Efficiency, on the other hand, could be computed by rationing what are known as Energy Sales Realization and Energy Sales Assessment. The four key data figures to be analyzed and assimilated in this project are - Input Energy, Energy Sales, Energy Sales Assessment, and Energy Sales Realization.

Responsibilities and Duties included:

- Data Acquisition from the Client Site in Jaipur.
- Assimilation and Compilation of Management Information System files and Billing Output Reports in MS-Excel as a part of the pre-visit Data Analysis.
- Routine follow-ups with Assistant Revenue Officers and Assistant Engineers for intimation regarding the audit visits and Data Acquisition at the Subdivision level.
- Identification of Sundry Cases under a variety of Tariff Codes' heads for which there is a huge discrepancy in the Average Billing Rate figures.
- Visiting the Subdivisions for Auditing and Analysis of Identified Cases.
- Data Analysis post the audit visit to compile the final figures in MS-Excel.

1. A Mathematical Model to Study the Dynamics of Prey, Mature and Immature Predator with Optimal Harvesting Policy.

In each of the above models, Analysis of Equilibriums, Stability Analysis, and Numerical Simulations via MATLAB were carried out. The Analysis of the two mathematical models was done with the help of Theory of Ordinary Differential Equations.

jobs.description: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering

I have done M.Tech in Microelectronics from Indian Institute of Information Technology Allahabad. I am working on ASIC design  from past 2 year, and had done various projects in Analog and Digital design. My area of interest is ADC & MODEM design. currently I am working on Sigma Delta ADC in 180nm CMOS technology using Cadence.

Analog Design, Digital Design, Mixed signal Design,Testing & Verification, MEMS.


 CURRENT PROJECT AS a PART OF M.Tech


Project Title	Designof an oversampled Sigma Delta Modulator ADC in 180 nm CMOS technology	

Technology node	180 nm	

Tool Used	Cadence 	

Project Description	This implements a high resolution ADC where analog design is tolerant for circuit non idealities and Component mismatch. In final stage there we have to implement a Digital Decimation Filter which exchange speed for resolution, and finally integrate the whole design. This is a type of oversampling ADC which exchange speed for resolution instead of extra hardware(e.g. in Flash ADC we need more number of comparator for high resolution); Mini Project	Baud rate generator	

HDL Used	VHDL, Verilog	

TOOL Used	Modelsim	

Project Description 	This is project which provides the different baud rates to UART, here we have written HDL code for baud rate generator and then performs timing analysis, and RTL.	

Project Title	Microcontroller controlled car parking system	

Microcontroller used	Microcontroller 8051	

Project Description	This implements a automatic car parking system, and the project uses IR sensing.

general.headline: Actively seeking ML/data science internships | MS CS at UT Austin | BITS Pilani alumnus
general.description: I am currently a first-year Master of Science in Computer Science (MS CS) student at the University of Texas at Austin (UT Austin). Previously, I was serving as a research assistant at the Center for Computation and Cognition (CCC), Department of Computer Science and Mathematics, Goethe University in Frankfurt under the supervision of Prof. Visvanathan Ramesh and Mr. Martin Mundt. I was broadly working on deep learning for computer vision at that time. My specific areas of research were deep neural architecture search using reinforcement learning, continual learning, deep generative replay, Bayesian inference, and statistical outlier detection and rejection. My time at CCC was very rewarding and I managed to jointly publish conference and workshop papers at CVPR 2019, ICCV 2019, and NeurIPS 2018. Even before that, I had spent four wonderful years at the Birla Institute of Technology and Science Pilani (BITS Pilani) before graduating with a Bachelor of Engineering (Hons) in Electronics and Instrumentation in July 2018.I am interested in machine learning (ML), specifically using deep learning and/or reinforcement learning to solve problems in computer vision and natural language understanding.  I am also open to working in data science projects. I am actively looking for internship opportunities in core ML or data science. If you have any offer, feel free to contact me.

jobs.description:
During the first half of the year-long research assitantship, I jointly worked with my mentors on curating the novel COncrete DEfect BRidge IMage (CODEBRIM) dataset for multi-target classification of five commonly appearing concrete defects and background. We compared two meta-learning approaches to find suitable convolutional neural network architectures for this challenging multi-class multi-target task. We observed that learned architectures have less overall parameters in addition to yielding better multi-target accuracy in comparison to best-in-practice CNN architectures from literature evaluated in the context of our application. We published a paper at the main conference of CVPR 2019. 

I also got an opportunity to investigate a common trend of montonically incrementing feature amount with depth in a convolutional neural network (CNN). Several architectures with the same total feature amount but with different distributions of features across layers were trained and their performance vis-a-vis a certain task was compared. The comparison resulted in some interesting observations which questioned the afore-mentioned common practice. I co-authored a paper from this investigation at the NeurIPS CRACT 2018 workshop.

Later during my time as an RA, my mentors and I worked on the problem of robust continual learning with deep generative replay and statistical outlier detection. We used variational autoencoders with a classifier sitting the latent embedding, to learn to make class-specific latent clusters and continually generate previously seen image data. We modified the OpenSet algorithm to provide confidence bounds vis-a-vis the generated data actually belonging to the old data distribution, by exploiting the class-specific posteriors. This resulted in a system that can keep generating high-quality data and continually learn new tasks while retaining old knowledge.  A workshop paper from this work was published at ICCV SDLCV 2019 workshop.

In this project, I designed a principled image recognition system that uses neural graph matching between model and image planes, and Gabor filters for feature extraction. The system involves a dynamic two-dimensional graph with Gabor filter stacks (corresponding to different orientations and frequencies) at each node. The dynamic nature of the graph (dynamic link architecture) allows for global positioning of the whole grid corresponding to the center of gravity of the object to be recognized and local restricted movements of the nodes to account for local translations of object pixels and rotation of the grid and individual Gabor wavelets to offset the non-zero orientation, if any, of the object under consideration. This leads to rotation and tranlation invariance of the system. This dynamic image graph us then matched against stored model graphs and the model graph with the best match gives the identity/label of the object recognized. I published a paper on MNIST recognition at JCP 2018.

jobs.companyName: Indian Institute of Remote Sensing (IIRS), Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO)
jobs.description: In a mobile mapping system, a global positioning system (GPS) measures time and acquires the global coordinates (Cartesian or Azimuthal) very precisely with the help of satellites while the terrestrial laser scanner (TLS) records the local coordinates at the point of measurement. Although the TLS has a clock for measuring time, the least count of it is in milliseconds which renders it less precise when compared with the time measurement by the GPS where the precision is in nanoseconds. Effective synchronisation is required in this case where the data points produced by the TLS can be mapped to the data points produced by the GPS with the timestamps as reference. Hence, it is necessary to pass the timestamp information from the GPS to the TLS at every point of measurement to succesfully map data points from the two devices. I solved this problem by using a third computer which used dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) and network control protocol (NCP) to interact with the GPS (NCP) and the TLS (DHCP). I wrote C++ code using proprietary RivLib libraries from the TLS manufacturer and bash scripts on the third computer for timestamp transfer. Besides, I used LibScan libraries and wrote C++ code for extraction of TLS data into a human-readable format (comma separated values). I presented a paper from this work at the techinal festival of BITS Pilani, APOGEE, and won the second prize in that category.

jobs.description:
â€¢	Lead, manage and mentor a large and diverse team of associates within a very fast-paced and high-volume environment.
â€¢	Drive and conduct dive deep analysis on complex processes. Achieve productivity targets, reduce cost per unit, eliminate errors to meet operations metrics daily. Be continuously proactive and create a culture of on-going process improvement within the workplace using KAIZEN and LEAN methodologies
â€¢	Be involved in projects and liaise with all teams across the FC and/or relevant external actors as required.

â€¢	Responsible for associate rostering for all the ART events & SVD events from Primeday â€™18 till date. The balanced headcount division function wise, gender wise, learning curve wise and shift wise ensured the achievement of targeted committed capacities and productivity
â€¢	During May ART â€™19, responsible for all peak deck metric exception management, bridge preparation, associate roster and headcount risk mitigation, flow management exceptions in CS, FRACS and Trans Out and warning of impending CPT risk to the leadership.
â€¢	Trained the PA and PS batch of MAA4 in FPY quality management & enabled them with the skill sets required
â€¢	Spearheaded the inter departmental Merger project of OB dock with FC dock in MAA4 by assessing the headcount requirement and impending risk which ultimately resulted in the reduction of 3P CPT misses and also ensured >99% X-Ray compliance.
â€¢	Acted as the POC for MAA4, and worked on the INFC Slam KO reduction project. This resulted in a 22% reduction in KO DPMO from 15645 to 11364. This reduction translated to a saving of 4.1 MM INR annually across INFC.
â€¢	Responsible for the increase in Pantry Pad from 1.5hrs to 2.5hrs in MAA4 by assessing the ExSD risk posed by the then existing pantry pad.
â€¢	Automated the DDD tracker and OOPS DPMO tracker using Excel VBA
â€¢	Dedicated Kaizens and collective team work to improve MAA4 OB productivity from a throughput of 36 TPH in  Julyâ€™18 to 43 TPH as of Jun â€™19, an improvement of 19.4%.

1. Project (Quality): Process improvements for reducing FPY DPMO

Reduced the outbound first pass yield DPMO at MAA4 and improved the quality of the processes. This was achieved through training the associates and developing a new onboarding structure to prevent errors contributed by newly trained associates.Provided insights to make the existing FPY portal a more standard one in order to get an accurate representation of the defects and their causes. Contributed in developing process improvements within the FC to reduce the defects in the processes of slamming, picking and packing, and decrease the DPMO contributed which would lead to a reduction in the scrap created in these processes. Developed methods to inculcate an attitude of taking up the data of defects and their causes on a regular basis and showing bias for action leading to the reduction in the number of defects.

2. Diversion of small ASINs from single non-sort picking

Identified the change in configuration that is required to divert the ASINs from a tough process path, which were demanding NP9 box recommendation to improve the pack productivity. As a consequence, during CPT times, the search for small items which were always lost among the large items was lessened. This also resulted in a decrease in box deviations.

3. Pack productivity improvement and cost savings by modifying the box recommendations

Did regular deep dives through the data of slam wrong box in FPY portal which helped to filter out the certification opportunities. Gone through the data of the grotesque ASINs on a regular basis and test them for SIOC, polybag and custom box. Developed methods to inculcate an idea of notification in the associates and process assistants in case of any genuine box deviation so that proper certification can be made. Trained associates of outbound in the testing and certification processes. All these activities had led to an increase in pack productivity and a decrease in cost to company.

jobs.description: The Institution of Engineers (India), 8 Gokhale Road, Kolkata is the national organization of engineers in India. The Institution of Engineers (India) has more than one million members in 15 engineering disciplines in 114 centers or chapters in India and overseas; it is the world's largest multi-disciplinary engineering professional society in engineering and technology world. The Institution of Engineers (India) was established in 1920 in Kolkata, West Bengal and is acclaimed to have pioneered non-formal education in engineering. The Institution of Engineers (India) conducts an examination of its associate membership. This examination is considered to be on par with B.E. / B.Tech. When contemplated as an eligibility qualification to write competitive examinations like the Indian Civil Service, Indian Engineering Services, GATE, etc., and for employment in Government, public and private sectors in India. This qualification is recognized by the Ministry of HRD, government of India, as equivalent to B.E./B.Tech. The Institution of Engineers (India) was incorporated by Royal Charter in 1935. It is currently headquartered in 8 Gokhale Road, Kolkata - 700020.

ndianOil has a sprawling world-class R&D Centre that is perhaps Asia's finest. jobs.description:
Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute (CEERI) is a pioneer research institute in India and a constituent laboratory of Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR India). It was established in 1953 for advanced research and development in the field of Electronics. I had been involved in two projects at this institute, the details of which are as follows:

âœ¦  "We didn't run out of planes, or television sets. We ran out of food" ~ Interstellar (2014)
There exists extra-ordinary potential in the betterment of current agricultural practices by the application of knowledge in various fields of computer science like AI, IoT, Data mining and more..., so as to serve the rising global population better. Under the guidance of Dr. Shashikant Sadistap (Sr. Principal Scientist & Head, Agri-electronics group), I worked on a project focused on, "Big Data Analytics in Precision agriculture". Hadoop, Map-reduce and tensor flow were some of the technologies that were used for the study.

âœ¦  UAVs are increasingly used for surveillance, fire detection, mapping, cartography, landslide monitoring, inspection, traffic monitoring, search and rescue etc. It is important for many of the aforementioned applications to perceive the scene in real-time. My second project at CEERI was related to object detection and recognition in aerial images taken from UAVs/MAVs; using the traditional approach viz-a-viz using a deep learning approach. It was supervised by Dr. Somsukla Maiti.

Project Leader, Startup Sphere for 2016-17, an initiative by CEL, BITS Pilani to promote entrepreneurial hustling and create a support system for on-campus startup enthusiasts.

-----

Organized the first ever E-Summit of BITS Pilani (March 23-26, 2017) in association with APOGEE, BITS Pilani's tech fest.  Highlights include guest lectures, panel discussion, mini events & Startup Weekend. 

Kickstarted the next big thing by CEL, BITS Pilani. Startup Sphere Mag- India's only student-run entrepreneurial publication will be launched in December 2017 with an aim to coherently integrate various initiatives by CEl while ensuring maximum learning for both, the users and the contributing members.

Each meetup focuses on a particular skill (like Graphic Designing, Excel, Web Development, etc) and allows the attendees to get a crash course on the basics to help them kickstart their learning.

Worked on CEL's new branding theme - "Think Big" and launched it on the new year's eve.
Also working on establishing permanent CEL blogs and new marketing strategy. Therefore, also focusing on new Campus Ambassador programme for outreach purposes.

customer issues including complex technical scenarios integrating several cloud capabilities (Windows Azure, IaaS, SQL Azure, AppFabric, etc.) and scenarios supporting the service such as service availability, Connectivity, quality, outage management, degradation of performance, correlation of usage and charges, and cost efficient solution architecture

-Work with Enterprise customers in implementing on-going SQL Server planning, operations, migration and deployment 

-Take ownership for product improvement, and participate in pre-release preview activities and BETA programs

-Successfully pitched Azure SQL Database as a potential product for non-SQL server customers and generated lead for the Sales team to help them migrate to Azure

- Develop and implement strategies with the Product team for providing proactive and facilitative support resulting in fewer incidents, increased availability, or accelerated deployments.

-Delivered multiple technical presentations to the User Group community and Premier Technical Account Managers to evangelize Azure SQL Database.



    
        â€¦
      
        see more

Analyzed enterprise environment of clientâ€™s organizations in healthcare, banking, retail and other domains- Designed the database implementation plan & provided end-to-end technological solutions to solve their technically complex production down issues

-Successfully pitched SQL server as a potential product for non-SQL server customers and generated lead for the Sales team to help them migrate to SQL server

-Delivered multiple technical presentations to the User Group community and developed text and blogs.

- Attend and organize triages discussing complex technical scenarios and solutions with varying customer skill levels leading to a deep understanding of the issue, root cause and resolution options.


Scenarios on a near-daily basis: 
- Assist developers and application team to optimize TSQL queries.
- Using Performance Data Collector, Windows Perfmon to identify system hardware bottleneck
- Designing Database Backup & Recovery policy
- Planned Data Security, Audit, Data Access, Data Integration and Transformation activities on SQL server
- Setup custom Database maintenance plan, DBCC, maintain statistics, Integrity Check, trace flags 
- Setting up Log Shipping and SQL Replication (transactional, merge, snapshot, P2P)
- Experience in creating instance/Database level SQL Auditing and Change Data Capture 
- Troubleshoot Performance issues like High Memory, High CPU using DMVs, system tables and scripts
- Evaluating Database Locking mechanism, Diagnosing and Resolving Deadlocks, blocking, Latch contention and timeouts
- Using SQL Server dashboard reports, DMVs and Profiler to identify slow application code or hardware resource consuming T-SQL queries
- Identify unused indexes; create missing indexes and regular reorg/rebuild Index maintenance
- Help troubleshoot issues related to database corruption and finding out root causes
- Installation & maintenance of SQL Clustering and other High Availability options like Database Mirroring


    
        â€¦
      
        see more

general.headline: Founder & CEO at Pepper | Building India's Largest Content Marketplace!
general.description: â€œIt passes before itâ€™s noticed; a slight raising of the eyebrows, a widening of the eyes. It may be accompanied by an almost imperceptible inhalation. The heart adds a beat, like a quiet exclamation point on the experience. Within a 10th of a second the reaction has passed, but not without leaving its mark. Someone found what theyâ€™re looking for. Does your content generate impulses to act? It can. Try Pepperâ€I am a final year undergraduate at BITS Pilani. I started Pepper a year and a half back. We envision to be the one-stop destination for content creation for vernacular, voice and video. We are currently creating the largest curated community of content creators in India through an AI-enabled platform.Over the past year, while managing college outside, I have successfully been able to build a team of 15 people and a network of 17500+ content creators which are creating content for over 150+ brands in India. From a completely bootstrapped model, I have been able to convert this to a profitable business by having raised revenues over $150,000 so far and have impending deals of $100,000 for the next few months. I love this quote, "Let me tell you something you already know. The world ain't all sunshine and rainbows. It's a very mean and nasty place and I don't care how tough you are it will beat you to your knees and keep you there permanently if you let it. You, me, or nobody is gonna hit as hard as life. But it ain't about how hard ya hit. It's about how hard you can get hit and keep moving forward. That's how winning is done!â€ If youâ€™re interested in grabbing a coffee and talking shop (or to hear how we almost missed creating a world record in college), please send an email my way at - anirudh.singla@pepper.org.in

jobs.description:
About the Swachh Maharashtra Grand Challenge:

The Swachh Maharashtra Grand Challenge is an open innovation platform that will identify, pilot and scale five innovative WASH programs in one district of Maharashtra.

These innovations will cut across the sanitation value chain in five key thematic areas such as technology innovation, innovative finance, behaviour change communication, operations and maintenance and waste management. Other focus themes for the Grand Challenge include school sanitation, promoting gender-equity in sanitation and water accessibility.

The winning innovators will not just receive grant funding, but will also receive innovation coaching, mentoring, technology transfer, business modelling and project management support through out the journey- the entire process being supported by knowledge partners and sector experts.

This project is being executed in partnership with Founding Fuel, which was started by the Founding Editors of Forbes.

Shri Devendra Fadnavis, the Honourable Chief Minister of Maharashtra, has chosen to support this Grand Challenge in partnership with some of the most influential leaders from the corporate and the social sector.

The Grand Challenge has a stellar advisory council which consists of Shri Kiran Karnik, Shri Piyush Pandey, Mr. Arun Maira, Mr. Mehmood Khan, Ms. Vedika Bhandarkar, Mr. Luis Miranda, Mr. Harsh Mariwala, Ms. Zenia Tata, Prof. Madhukar Shukla, Prof. Rishikesh Krishnan.


About Samhita Social Ventures:

Samhita Social Ventures is a social-sector consulting firm that builds long term partnerships between companies, philanthropists, donor organizations, government agencies and social organizations to maximize social impact.

Samhita was founded seven years ago with support from Mr. NS Raghavan, who is also the co-founder and former Chairman of Infosys.

jobs.description:
Project - Concept Tagger
The aim of this project was to use Machine Learning to build a Python module which could automate tagging of concepts for questions on an online educational platform . By tagging each question with concepts and then evaluating the score obtained by the student in different questions, a student's strong and weak areas could be assessed. Concept tagging was achieved by making use of LDA(Latent Dirichlet Allocation) model.

jobs.companyName: Homi Bhabha Centre for Science Education (HBCSE), TIFR
jobs.description:
Project - Search Engine for DOER
Built an offline Search Engine for DOER ( Decentralized Distributable Disk of Offline Open Educational Resources). DOER is a cluster of servers available offline that includes NROER, Khan Academy Lite , Wikipedia and other educational resources. The aim was to be able to search through information on these multiple servers. A crawler integrated to ElasticSearch populates its database and the index created is queried through ElasticSearch's API which is called through a web application based on AngularJS. To ensure platform independence, everything is packaged into an image. Technologies used included Elasticsearch , AngularJS and Docker .

Project â€“ HMIS Application
I worked at L&T Safdarjung Hospital Project Site on HMIS ( Hospital Management Information System ) application at as a part of 1 month internship at L&T.  The application was aimed at having a common system across multiple hospitals to access, modify and keep track of medical records for every patient so that a patient doesn't need to carry his/her medical records.

general.description: My life's mission statement, at age 28:My motto: 'Social Welfare for a Better World'A Humanitarian: That too one who would forsake all the riches and titles for the most noble and lost cause. With efforts and patronage; than mere words.A Management graduate who graduated in the class of 2014 with distinguished performance and a degree of Bachelor of Business Administration.I have a keen interest in improving the financial situation, government administration and poverty alleviation; not only in India-the country of my origin-but the world-over, eventually and gradually.A Chartered Wealth ManagerÂ® charter holder and a successful entrepreneur with excellent performance in national and international level Olympiads. I am a personality who is deeply engrossed and interested in reform in the currently-stigmatized Indian political scenario. Yet, since I am a novice in policy-making and governmental administration hence I seek tutelage and mentoring in this regard.My background:Inheritor of a legacy that goes back to Lord Shiva himself, his descendants Universal Emperor Yayati, Puru, Karna, founder of Delhi, Dhillon, Chaudhary Langaha of my ancestral village of Jhubal Kalan, Patti, Amritsar District, Punjab, India. Also inheritor of a rich modern legacy of my ancestors vanquishing belligerent Afghans under Maharaja Hari Singh Dhillon from Indus to Sutlej.Vanquishing of tyrannical Mongols/Mughals by a descendant of Chaudhary Langaha- Maharaja Baghail Singh Dhariwal/Dhaliwal/Dhankhar (Dhillon of Jhubal Kalan by birth); Emperor from  Sutlej to Ganges and conqueror of Mughal Delhi. Also a brave woman General Mai Bhago a daughter born to Ch Langaha's brother Bhai Pero Shah.My agendas:Elimination of crime, hunger and violation of human rights. Restoration of classical languages such as Arabic and Persian and Sanskritic languages such as Sanskrit, Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam, Punjabi, Bangla, Gujarati, Konkani, Sindhi and more and rare dialects such as Brajbhasha, Bhojpuri, Awadhi, Maithili, Kumaoni and more. Opening flow of commerce, technology and ideas within the Indian subcontinent, Asia, Eurasia, Northern and Southern Hemispheres. Restoration of Sufi shrines, languishing Temples of all major Indian faiths, charitable Christian missions is what I want to add on to this legacy. Sponsorship and nurturing of talent in sports, arts, education, finance and technology are also my core agendas.

jobs.description: CERN - HSF

Worked on an bettering the existing Information Retrieval system, creation of in-house embeddings and training of Stance Detection Models. All were as part of micro-services.
 
The Information Retrieval system involved retrieving necessary news articles, given a query. This was done by computing sentence representations given individual word representations, and ranking the article based on the similarity between query and the sentence representations of a particular article.

The embeddings were created through a combination of neural network models i.e., an ensemble of models(Character CNN + BiLSTM) implemented in tensorflow. This kind of model helped in capturing the semantic + syntactic + context(depending on sentence) for a particular word. The model states were also initialised with pre-trained states(graph initialisation) of the same model trained on general datasets so that they have a greater general domain understanding.

Involved in understanding and writing training scripts for stance detection models to detect if two pieces of articles have the same view points regarding a particular topic. The model trained had Tree-LSTMs for syntactic parsing through text which helped in the task of predicting stance between two sentences.

National Chemical Laboratory (CSIR-NCL), Pune, established in 1950, is a constituent laboratory of Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR). CSIR-NCL is a science and knowledge-based research, development and consulting organization. It is the highest funded CSIR in India. 

As an Intern, I got to work with Dr. Imranur Rehaman, Scientist at NCL on a project. The following are the specifications of the work I did as a Volunteer:

1. Calculated the values of the pressure drops for various types of structured packings in a distillation 
    column with the aid of a self-designed software.
2. Extracted the data from the capacity parameter vs. pressure drop graph with the help of 
    WebPlotDigitizerÂ© and generated a Logarithmic Curve Regression Model using Python to obtain the 
    values of the pressure drop as a function of the capacity parameter.
3. Estimated the expected flooding, required column diameter and capacity parameter within the error 
    of 3% as a function of feed loads, feed fluid properties, and the type of structured packing.
4. Designed a GUI in the form of an executable file using Microsoft VisualStudio2019 Â© which performs 
    the mentioned calculations by taking the values of feed loads, feed fluid properties, and the type of 
    structured packing as inputs.

general.company: Department of Visual Media, BITS Pilani
general.description: I'm a student and developer who loves to materialize my visions, and I found that the best way to bring my ideas to life is through code. I believe that computers and well written programs are a great way to solve many problems in life, especially as our world grows increasingly dependent on software and technology.I love using Python as my main weapon of choice. This choice has enabled me to write clean and powerful code to tackle problems ranging from creating scripts to automate tedious tasks on a day-to-day basis to building web-based systems that are efficient, easy to maintain, and easy to extend.

jobs.companyName: Department of Visual Media, BITS Pilani
jobs.description:
The Department of Visual Media is a student lead organization which creates software for all of BITS Pilani, Pilani campus's fests. Here, I work to build, deploy and monitor backend related software.

While working here, I learned to communicate and collaborate with a team of fellow student developers to produce code that would help run all of the fests at BITS Pilani, and increase their revenue. It was also here that I discovered the joy of Linux systems administration and devops.

During OASIS '18 I worked on developing an e-wallet which fest participants and university students could use to order food from stalls by prepaying with cash or by withdrawing money from their student accounts (would be added to the student's end of semester fees). This was combined with a ticket purchasing and QR based entry system for the fest's shows, the backend and API for which I also developed.

Later during APOGEE '19, I overhauled the e-wallet and tickets manager codebases based on what I learnt from deploying the OASIS  '18 code in a live environment.

The overhaul included:
1. Increasing the modularity and readablilty.
2. Increasing efficiency by reducing the number of network calls executed.
3. Adding a test suite to test core functionality.
4. Adding documentation to make things easier for fellow developers on the app/frontend side.

jobs.jobTitle: Google Summer of Code with The Zulip Open Source Project
jobs.description:
I worked as a student developer / summer intern at The Zulip Open Source Project as part of the Google Summer of Code (GSOC) program.

For background, Zulip is a team communications application and the leading open-source alternative to Slack. It's actively developed by an international team of open source developers and maintained by the core team from Kandra Labs, led by Tim Abbott. By joining them, I was able to get a taste for writing professional quality code that would be used by hundreds of thousands of people across the globe. Apart from the new technical skills that I developed here, I learnt a lot about what it's like to work in a large and formal team of well qualified individuals and about how to write clean, modular code that is easy to review.

My project abstract and link to final work product can be viewed at the official GSoC website:
https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/projects/#5337855780454400

My contributions to the project can be viewed directly on GitHub at:
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/commits?author=Hypro999

ASIs will act as the primary conduit between campus students and the Amazon Alexa team. Alexa Student Influencers are leaders who have a craving to learn new technologies in AI and Voice Technologies, and also share it with their fellow student colleagues.

jobs.description:
India`s only supercritical powerplant with 5x660 MW at maximum capacity.
4 Projects effectuated:-
1) Healthiness determination of Boiler Sensors:- Using Acoustic Sensor and soot blower data for a boiler, whether a sensor tube is choked or free was determined.
2) Boiler Tube Leakage Prediction System:- A tool was created in the SCADA system which would predict the boiler tube leakages , 1-7 days before the actual outrage.
3) Worker Detection System in Confined Spaces:- Using RFID sensors, transmitters and Arduino, a program to detect the number of workers present in a given area was created.
4) Hazardous Gas Detection:- A small circuit was created that could fit on the helmets of workers, that would detect the presence of hazardous gases in its close proximity and alert the worker using an alarm.

general.headline: Secretary at The Wall Street Club | BITS Pilani
general.description: Getting to the bottom of everything may be a tough task, a task which takes long hours of research over the Internet, reading in between the lines and coming up with new insights which nobody generally notices. But as a die-hard critical thinker, this has been my lifelong passion.My passionate curiosity towards anything I come across and the thirst to understand its nuances leads me to seek engaging conversations with my acquaintances, forcing us to brainstorm over various topics of shared interests. I used my abilities to my best in professional quizzing, cracking difficult questions with the help of my quizzing partners, in front of a large audience, under high pressure. But then I decided to pause. This quest for knowledge made me learn the basics everything under the sun from Theology to Geology. I need to specialize! Where can I use my knowledge to the benefit of humanity?According to me, the two levers of the world which decide the fate of humanity on a larger scale is :a. Credit, access to Credit and availability/flow of Capital b. Management of People/Resources and its AdministrationHmmm. It all makes sense! In all my internships, I made use of my passion to deliver favorable outcomes to all the organizations where I have been employed. And most of what I did at BITS Pilani revolved around my passion and the two levers. Now, all that I need is a full-time opportunity (and yes, a mentor to teach the ropes) to utilize my full potential. Would it be you?

jobs.companyName: Bhaskaracharya Institute For Space Applications and Geo-Informatics
jobs.description:
This project was done in under the supervision of senior project managers at Bhaskaracharya Institute for Space Applications and Geo-informatics in collaboration with Gujarat Power Research and Development Cell.
With no such pre-existing model to simulate and analyze real-time electrical networks, the need for a geo electrical network simulation tool is enormous. Simulation saves us from the effort of setting up electrical poles and/or transformers in real geographical locations which can be very tiresome and expensive. Our main aim in this project has been to provide an user-friendly interface for such simulation. This can be helpful in optimizing the network flow which in turn can be crucial in setting up real-time poles in useful areas such that the network flow stays optimized and electric flow is not hindered. The delivered prototype works well.
On completion of the project we completed the Innovation challenge and hence were provided with a scholarship.

Responsibilities and Tasks completed:
1. Conducted survey and collected data pertaining to each node (electric pole) in an electrical
network for a given city.
2. Created an user friendly Geo-Electrical network Simulation tool (in a team of three) to analyze and
visualize real time changes made into the electrical survey data and look for possible ways to
optimize the network
3. The code was written in JavaScript and Python. PgAdmin, Postgres, PostGIS were some out of
the many tools used in completing the task.
4. We did this project in collaboration with Gujarat Power Research and Development Cell, a
department under the supervision of the government of Gujarat

Achievements:
Was awarded the BISAG Innovation Challenge scholarship upon completing the task.
Was awarded a strong Letter of Recommendation from Dr. Manoj Pandya, a senior project
scientist and an excellent project manager at BISAG.

jobs.companyName: Gujarat Power Engineering and Research Institute
jobs.description:
Responsibilities and Tasks completed:
1. Collected electric meter reading video recordings as data.
2. We read the electric meter reading data from video recordings using OpenCV libraries (Video
Processing).
3. Used Scikit for KNN classification.
4. Created a simulation based visualization circuit (in a team of three).
5. This project was based on the Geo-electrical network simulation tool and this was done in
collaboration with Bhaskaracharya Institute for Space Applications and Geo-informatics.

Achievements:
Was awarded the certificate of merit from the Government of Gujarat on completion of the
project.
Was awarded a Letter of Recommendation from the Superintending Engineer of the Gujarat R&D
Cell, GUVNL, Gandhinagar, Gujarat.

general.headline: Data Scientist (Global Data Science)  at Dun & Bradstreet | M.Tech in Data Science at BITS Pilani
general.description: Data Scientist | Machine Learning EngineerI work for Dun & Bradstreet as an Analyst with sole focus on Machine Learning algorithm and solutions on Fraud analytics , Credit Risk management and Custom models. I am a part of team developing D&B Flagship projects on Risk Management. Whilst Working on projects involving D&B internal projects and their clients (Microsoft ,  T-Mobile , AT&T ). Also working closely with the innovation team to bring out new solutions such as :- 1. Entity resolutions for Business Stakeholders to identify risk for small businesses. 2. Developing scores using Deep Learning techniques to identify the likelihood of anomaly in payments/behaviours to capture risky customers. I worked as a consultant to Udacity , Where I utilized my specialized knowledge in the field(s) of Data Science , Machine Learning and Deep Learning and my strong communication skills to provide project reviews and other student support services. Also have experience as a Data Science trainer and have taken more than 4+ batches for online educational set ups like UpGrad and Acadview.

jobs.description:
D&B Technologies is subsidary company of D&B and mainly responsible for providing analytics and technology services to Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) and its clients globally. D&B are responsible for building analytical models for Credit fraud detection , Credit risk analysis/Prediction , Sales analytics and Supply chain management. 

As an Analyst , I am a part of the D&B's transformation journey towards advanced analytics and Machine Learning models and products on Risk / Fraud Detection and D&B Flagship products.

- Developed Machine Learning models and providing solutions for Fortune 50 companies , Such as T-Mobile , AT&T and Microsoft in the field of Risk Management. 

- Developed marketing models for Wex and Walmart , to identify potential customers (B2B)  

- Creating algorithms to combine traditional Risk models with the advanced Machine learning concepts. 

- Developed inhouse analytical framework for Risk/Fraud detection to identify risky customers for efficient risk management. 

- Developed solutions for Entity Resolution , Enabling Stakeholders to find fraudulent companies through it's stakeholders and their performances.  

- Working on implementation of Risk models for the UK Government. Which would involve a UI and Batch scoring process. 

- Working on a smart data building system to integrate 4000+ data sources and using matching resolutions to identify correct information is used for Data build. 

- Working on creating a platform for easier ML Model development for non-native users.  

- Conducting regular in-house training on Python , Machine Learning. 

Technologies :- Python , R , SAS , PySpark , Spark , Hadoop , Hive , SQL , Flask

general.headline: Master of Technology - MTech at Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
general.description: An enthusiastic, creative & highly motivated Mechanical Engineer with expertise in Quality Management,Design & Development, Operations Management and Operational Excellence.Possesses a broad range of technical, analytical and leadership skills.Applies rigorous logic and methods to come up with effective solutions to different problems and demonstrated success in problem solving with strong attention to detail.Proficient in using 7 QC tools, Six Sigma DMAIC principles,FEA & CFD software’s, MiniTab & advanced CAD designing tools.

jobs.description:
•Prepare and review the Quality Planning for In-coming, In-process and Final product Quality, Product reliability testing, Environmental tests & Accelerated Life testing. 
•Introduced various problem solving & trouble shooting tools and techniques like SPC, SQC tools, RCA, 5Why,CAPA, ISIKAWA, PM analysis to reduce the rejections and improve the KPI’s of Quality function.
•Build and lead the Cross Functional Team (CFT) to improve the Product Quality level, Improve OEE and reduce wastages. 
•Ensure supply of Quality products to major OEMs. Manage customer quality concerns / complaints, preparing “8D” improvement plan. 
•Implementation of Industry 4.0 and customizing software for real time analysis on OEE, Rejection trend, Productivity, Downtime, Energy Consumption of each machines.
•Working on Energy Management by monitoring Energy consumption per hour and optimizing process for least energy consumption.
•Testing of materials & components using Melt Flow Index, Tensile Testing Machine, Push Pull Tester, Color Matching Cabinets.
•Monitoring Process Parameters of Injection Moulding Machines ranging from 100 Tonnes to 650 Tonnes, Hot foiling Machines, Ultasonic Welding Machine & Hot Oven Conveyor.
•Coordinator for Kaizen & 5S Activites across the plant. 
•Responsible for data analysis and preparing Continuous Improvement plan.
•Preparation of Process Flow Chart,PPAP,ISIR,PIS, QCFC, PFMEA, Control Plan, Work Instructions.
•Responsible for quality of product produced as per set quality standards.

•Develop new ideas to improve and sustain the current products.
•Select, test and qualify new components.
• Prepare bench marking for similar products.
• Prepare design drawings / bills 
• Prepare materials and process specifications.
• Prepare of BOM,PRN,ECN,FPA, Production manuals, Product Specification,Material Specification,Process Specifications & catalogs.
• Manage development and sustaining activities to meet customer and product requirements within schedule, cost and quality guidelines. 
• Implement cost improvement and competition cost analysis.
• Support in material productivity programs by introducing new alternatives for (designs, components and process).
•Maintaining alignment of Engineering projects and initiatives (Process & Products engineering activities) with the business unit's goals and overall strategic plan.
•BOM verification as per new model release.
•Reliability Run test of components.
•Testing of water coolers as per IS 1475-part 1
•Balancing of water-cooler machines.
•Testing of water-coolers as per dispatch plan keeping in view BEE norms and National Standards.
•Making proto samples of machines for development or any change in product.
•Making Tubing as per drawing and fitment.
•Involvement in Mould Design, Sheet Metal Design & PCB Design.
•Involvement in Mould Costing & Injection Moulding Conversion Costing.
•Implementation of 5S, Six Sigma,Lean Manufacturing & 7 quality control tools .
•Value Engineering & Value Analysis.
•Selection of RO systems for domestic applications and subsequent filters ( Pre-Filter, Sediment Filter, GAC Filter, PAC Filter, SICF, AA Filters, RO membrane, NF, UF etc ) while conforming water quality as per IS 10500.
•To ensure the final quality of component by proper inspection dimensional, visual, functional and testing as per specified norms according to quality plans.
•Analysis of rejection by Pareto graph, Why-Why analysis, Ishikawa diagram, Histogram and taking the corrective action for reduce the rejection.

-Involvement in Manpower and Efficiency Calculation, Product Conversion Costing, Review of Operational Working Procedure Manual to comply for continual improvement in accordance with ISO 9001,ISO 14001,OSHAS 18001 and API 5L.
-Inspection and testing in manufacturing line using Destructive and Non-Destructive Testing such as Tensile, Hardness, Corrosion testers, X-ray radiography, Film developer and Eddy current testing.
-Preparation of Weekly Production Report, Monthly Production Report, Efficiency Report, Skill Matrix, Hydro-test Report, Raw material Inspection Certificate, Non-Conformity Reports, Mill Test Certificate and Delivery Reports.
-Involvement in Surveillance Audit for the Integrated Management System ISO 9001, ISO 14001, OSHAS 18001 conducted by TUV NORD.
- Training for the basic concept of Stainless Tubular products in Forming Section, Automatic TIG-Plasma Welding Method, Heat Treatment, Pipe End Facing, Pickling and Passivation, Pressure Hydro-Testing Etc.

•Training on the basic concept in manufacture of air-conditioners in Metal forming,Fabrication,Powder Coating,Heat Exchanger coil making,Tube bending etc. 
•Preparation of Work Instructions, BOM, Product & Process Specifications. 
•BOM Compliance, Performance check & FG Leak Test.
•Ensure standard / specified operational procedures/ work instruction / self-Inspection.
•Monitor rejection/ rework and act immediately on controlling and preventing of it.
•Responsible for quality of product produced as per set quality standards. 
•To take reporting from subordinates about their yesterday working.
•To find improvement points of subordinate by suggestion & communicate them and ensure that these are understood.
•Develop new ideas to improve and sustain the current products.
• Support in material productivity programs by introducing new alternatives for (designs, components and process).
•BOM verification as per new model release.
•Reliability Run test of components.

-Perform Heat load estimation,HAP, Pipe size calculation and Air terminal selection using BETA program.
 -Preparation of BOQ, Cost benefit analysis, technical specifications  & tender documents.
-Estimation of Project, Stairwell Pressurization System Designing, Equipment Selection and Drafting.
-Pump head calculations and drawing preparation.
