jobs.description:
Working in Network and Security team for one of EFI’s oldest products called as Fiery in Printing Industry!
•	Handling Networking and security for Fiery which is required for printers connected to fiery to have proper security from vulnerabilities.
•	We regularly work on scan reports generated by our QA for delivering and maintaining a secure Fiery for our customers.
•	Here We cater to a variety of customers, major ones being Canon, Ricoh, Xerox, etc.
•	My work also requires me to address customer issues for all huge range of products. Solving customer issues can involve any amount of work such as upgrading of binaries, changing networking protocol, changing security levels, etc. This is one area where we usually work on higher priority
•	My work mostly requires me to work in C/C++ as Fiery is built on the same!
•	Also, while handling network security patches for older systems (systems in market) we do have to work in scripting languages Python or Perl to keep our customers secure of any possible security attacks 
•	I have gained good knowledge of ClearCase software configuration management (SCM) along with few other development tools such as Pycharm, Visual Studio.
•	In case of OS Platforms, we mostly deal with either Windows (7 and above) or Linux based systems (deb4, deb7) till now!

Worked in one of EFI's main and the oldest product called "Fiery"
I was working in "Fiery Core" where I was exposed to Fiery ..how It's working..how is it different from normal Printing..what does it adds to Printing Industry ..how and why is it so valuable to EFI ..how it managed all these years with technology outside advancing day by day ..how is it successful in helping EFI become sole choice or if not sole choice then how it became the best alternative to anything available for customers in Digital Printing World?
I worked on a Project where I was supposed to write a full fledged C++ application which should be developed to run varieties of tests on Fiery for confirming whether it is working fine or not with variable number of threads and changing execution time for test for any test case which has to be developed separately.
So, basically it was about having a standalone C++ application which can run on top of any standard tests(written seprately) on Fiery systems.
I completed this project with having about two to three tests apart from the Main Application.
Main Application(exe) will now load these tests (written in dll-but satisfying format set by main application) and then will run it severeal times which can be either based on number of runs, total time allowed to run and number of threads allowed to spawn for the given task. 
This activity helped me in getting good exposure to Visual Studio C++, C++11, Harmony API, Software Development Process and Clearcase which were required to  successfully complete my project.
Finally after all this I would like to recommend EFI to Final Year guys as this is the time where we are supposed to learn things which we should understand before going into Software Development World!
I can assure you Lot of team outings, free lunch and many great teams to work with.

    
        …

general.description: Experienced Founder with a demonstrated history of working in the computer software industry and an Advanced Level Mathematics Enthusiast. Strong Business Development Professional with a Bachelor of Technology - B.Tech focused in Computer Science from Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani.

jobs.description:
DroneX is a Startup Company which I had founded in April 2019, but the idea was there in my mind for quite some time.

The Idea of DroneX was presented at The BITS Innovation Challenge 2019 (Innovation Championship in BITS, Pilani), where it could pave it's way to the Finals. This Startup Company was highly praised by the Jury for it's encouragement in the Innovative Use of Technology.

So at DroneX, we are basically developing a Website and Mobile Application for the easy renting and buying of highly specialized drones, with high quality cameras and can be easily used while on a trek or camping trip as the Mobile Application can also help you monitor those cameras, so as to find your way out of the dungeon, if at all you get stuck anywhere. Not only this, but these drones will also be having GPS and in-built WiFi Routers, so as to be able to gain access to the internet at odd places, where you never expected to get a connection.

Not only this much, but also, we would introduce a special sort of drone with a frame to put your phone inside into. Having a phone attached to a phone will have many advantages such as getting clearer pictures and videos in well-enough high quality and also digital image stabilization, which is a specialization in today’s smartphones. Also, these drones will be able to fetch signal to your mobile to run the maps, so as to be able to get out of somewhere you are lost in at.

jobs.description:
Team BITS is a collegiate team of undergrad engineers from BITS Pilani that aim to build ultra-fuel-efficient vehicles and contribute towards the future of mobility and take part in Shell Eco-Marathon, Asia. The team made 1st Indian car to run on 100% Ethanol. Now we are working on Battery Electric Car Project alongside the development of Self-Driving Car Software. I am currently working under the controller subsystem providing team significant software support and heading the Autonomous Subsystem.
I am also acting as a Pitching Head for the Team.

Project under KB Engine Plant and ITD (Gurgaon Plant) to create a Dashboarding tool to help Production line Heads and Supervisors to spot faults in pretty large production lines and also helping them in predicting upcoming possible failures. Another Project included Optimisation of Vehicles Routes of different consignees all over India in the Logistics Department, MSIL.

Haryana Government decided to provide free IIT/PMT Coaching to 100 financially challenged students under the project "SUPER 100". Haryana Government tied with Vikalpa Foundation, Rewari to coach these students and took 100% responsibility to fund the program.

Seeing this effort for a very good cause, I reached out to Vikalpa Foundation if I could help them in some way. Luckily, they needed a Designer and Publicist as the Entrance test was taken in all 21 districts of Haryana and should reach to maximum people in both urban and rural areas.

In very strict deadlines; Posters, Newspaper articles, News channels coverages, Banners, Articles, Brochures, Website, forms etc. were planned, designed and executed by me under the Guidance of Director of the VIKALPA FOUNDATION, Naveen Mishra (CSE, IIT-Delhi)

general.headline: BITS Pilani | Former Intern at NUS | Finance | Deep Learning
general.description:
I am an undergraduate student at BITS Pilani, K. K. Birla Goa Campus, pursuing double major in
      
      Economics and Computer Science and I am interested in finance, data science, business and trading.

jobs.description:
- Successfully completed the program on 'Data Analytics using Deep Learning' under Global Academic Internship Programme (GAIP). The program was held in association with Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Education Services and the Strategic Technology Management Institute @ National University of Singapore (STMI@NUS).
- The program consisted of coursework on Machine Learning and Deep Learning methods with Hands-on sessions (using python programming language) conducted by NUS School of Computing faculty and HPE instructors. The materials and lectures were as per the NUS School of Computing (Computer Science) course CS5242 (Neural Networks and Deep Learning).
- The program also consisted of doing a project which solved a real world problem. We scraped and prepared our own data, used deep learning models like CNN, RNN etc. and also deployed the project in a platform like Android App, Web Application etc.

As a Research Consultant in the WorldQuant Virtual Research Center, I built quantitative trading models (alphas) using statistical arbitrage on WebSim (WorldQuant's propitiatory platform). I had built 400+ alphas during my time as a Research Consultant. My goal was to build high-quality alphas i.e alphas which have robust performance (High PnL, High Sharpe Ratio, Low Turnover) in the previous 10 years of back-testing.
